coe318.lab2

Class ComplexNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • coe318.lab2.ComplexNumber

  • public class ComplexNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    ComplexNumber models a complex number expressed in rectangular form (real and imaginary parts). It is an immutable object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComplexNumber(double re, double im)
      Construct a ComplexNumber given its real and imaginary parts.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ComplexNumber add(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the sum of this and z.
      ComplexNumber divide(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is this divided by z.

      Returns the imaginary component.
      double getReal()
      Returns the real component.

      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the product of this and z.
      ComplexNumber negate()
      Returns a new ComplexNumber number that is the negative of this.
      ComplexNumber reciprocal()
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the reciprocal of this.
      ComplexNumber subtract(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the difference of this and z.

      • divide

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this / z

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this in the format: 
         real +-(optional) i imaginary
        If the imaginary part is zero, only the real part is converted to a String. A "+" or "-" is placed between the real and imaginary parts depending on the the sign of the imaginary part.

        Examples: 

          ..println(new ComplexNumber(0,0); -> "0.0"
  ..println(new ComplexNumber(1,1); -> "1.0 + i1.0"
  ..println(new ComplexNumber(1,-1); -> "1.0 - i1.0"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation.
